intro: Crataegus efferata, commonly known as the Canadian hawthorn, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to North America. It typically grows to a height of 3–10 meters and is characterized by its thorny branches and oval, dark green leaves. The plant produces white or pink flowers in spring, followed by red or orange berries in the fall. It thrives in a variety of soil types but prefers well-drained conditions and full sun. Crataegus efferata is often found in woodland edges, thickets, and disturbed areas across Canada and the northern United States.
